summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 regarding the approval of travel for an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York to the United Kingdom. The purpose of the trip is to conduct an in-person interview with a victim/witness in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, who was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence involves coordination between AUSAs and travel authorization staff.

persons.name: Moe
persons.context: The AUSA who is traveling to the UK to interview a victim/witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The travel memo is for her approval.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject of the case for which the victim/witness is being interviewed. The victim was also a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the perpetrator of the crimes against the victim/witness who is to be interviewed in the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Moe is an AUSA involved in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, traveling to interview a victim/witness related to that case.
The document references a victim who was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and is a witness in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, implying their connection in the alleged crimes.

events.title: Planned UK Travel for Victim Interview
events.description: An AUSA from SDNY plans to travel to the UK to conduct an in-person interview with a victim/witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The victim will only speak in person, and the interview is necessary to preserve her testimony for trial.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: In October 2020, the SDNY sought approval for an AUSA to travel to the UK to interview a victim/witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The victim was also a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and would only provide her statement in person, necessitating the travel to preserve her testimony for trial.
The email chain shows internal DOJ coordination for foreign travel authorization for case-related witness interviews.
